title.narrative: Access to Quality Education for Drought-Affected Children in Rural Areas of Bari Region of Puntland

description.narrative: This project proposes a 10-month intervention aimed at improving access to quality education and WASH inputs for drought as well as conflict affected students in remote areas of Bari region of Puntland State of Somalia through the provision of education supplies, emergency take away food rations for students and family food rations for teachers to meet their food and energy needs and motivate teachers to stay in the schools, sanitary kits for adolescent girls to facilitate their regular attendance at school, increasing water storage capacity, rehabilitation/extension of water points and latrines and safe drinking water supply to schools to provide for student and teacher safe drinking water needs, and improving hygiene practices among children through engagement with community hygiene promoters. The project will provide training on the roles and responsibilities, water management, food management, and Disaster Risk Reduction (DRR) for Community Education Committee (CEC) members of the respective schools. The project will also train community hygiene promoters on hygiene promotion, psycho-social support and child protection and safeguarding as they will be closely interacting with children during hygiene promotion sessions. Water for schools will be provisioned through water tanks with increased and improved water storage facilities. This will ensure children remain in school and learn in a protected, adequately resourced, and safe environment. Further, the CECs will be trained on DRR to build their capacity and preparedness to respond to future disasters. Minor rehabilitation of schools will be carried out to provide a safe and secure learning environment to children. Water points and gender friendly latrines in the targeted schools will be rehabilitated/extended to allow girls and boys to access the facilities in order to avoid disruptions in learning. Back to school campaign will be launched through mobile radio by airing messages with special focus to encourage enrollment of IDPs children. The Ministry of Women's Development and Family Affairs' (MoWDAFA) Regional Child Protection Coordinator will be engaged to strengthen the child protection referral mechanism at the regional level. The regional Education in Emergency (EiE) coordination system will be strengthened in Bari through monthly meetings of humanitarian agencies in the Education sector to coordinate the response and minimize duplication. This system will linked with the Puntland-level EiE Working Group for discussion, refinement, and sharing of lessons learned.
